intro: Odonellia hirtiflora, commonly known as the hairy-flowered odonellia, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its foliage is aromatic and can be used in culinary applications, though it is less common than other members of its family. Odonellia hirtiflora thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or open areas.
